revision.text:
{{about|the American actress|the Australian Olympic swimmer|Rachel Harris|similarly named people|Rachel Harris (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox person | name = Rachael Harris | image = Rachael Harris by Gage Skidmore.jpg | caption = Harris at the 2017 [[WonderCon]] | birth_name = Rachael Elaine Harris | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1968|1|12}} | birth_place = [[Worthington, Ohio|Worthington]], [[Ohio]], US | other_names = Rachel Harris | alma_mater = [[Otterbein College]] | occupation = Actress, comedian | spouse(s) = {{marriage|Adam Paul
|2003|2008|reason=divorced}}
{{marriage|[[Christian Hebel]]
|2015}} | children = 1 | years_active = 1992–present }} '''Rachael Elaine Harris''' (born January 12, 1968) is an [[US|American]] actress and comedian. She is known for her numerous television roles, such as starring as Dr. Linda Martin on ''[[Lucifer (TV series)|Lucifer]]'' and as a guest star on TV shows such as ''[[Sister, Sister (TV series)|Sister, Sister]]'', ''[[Reno 911!]]'', ''[[New Girl (U.S. TV series)|New Girl]]'', ''[[Suits (U.S. TV series)|Suits]]'' and ''[[The Good Wife]]''. ==Career== ===Stage=== Harris performed with the [[Los Angeles]] [[improvisational comedy]] troupe the [[Groundlings]] and taught for a time with the Groundlings school.{{cite web| url= http://aaronalper.com/interviews/rachael.html |last= Alper| first= Aaron| title= Rachael Harris Sounds Off| work=[[Tampa Bay Times]]| date= March 2005| publisher= AaronAlper.com}} [[Off-Broadway]], she performed in ''[[Love, Loss, and What I Wore]]''.{{cite web|url=http://one-dress.ning.com/profiles/blogs/now-playing-love-loss-and-what|title=Now Playing: "Love, Loss and What I Wore"|accessdate=2011-07-16|date=2010-07-20|last=Harris|first=Malcolm|publisher=One Dress Project|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120327174839/http://one-dress.ning.com/profiles/blogs/now-playing-love-loss-and-what|archivedate=2012-03-27|df=}} ===Television=== [[File:Rachael Harris 2 by David Shankbone.jpg|right|thumb|Harris at the April 2007 [[Tribeca Film Festival]].]] She debuted on television in a 1993 episode of ''[[SeaQuest DSV]]''. After an appearance on ''[[Star Trek: Voyager]]'' in 1997, Harris went on to a recurring role in [[The WB]]'s ''[[Sister, Sister (TV series)|Sister, Sister]]''. Other television credits include a stint as a correspondent for ''[[The Daily Show|The Daily Show's]]'' 2002–2003 season, as well as guest roles on ''[[The Sarah Silverman Program]]'', ''[[Reno 911!]]'', ''[[The West Wing (television)|The West Wing]]'', ''[[The Good Guys (2010 TV series)|The Good Guys]]'', ''[[Friends]]'', ''[[Curb Your Enthusiasm]]'', ''[[Monk (TV series)|Monk]]'', ''[[CSI: Crime Scene Investigation]]'', and ''[[Desperate Housewives]]'' in November 2008. Harris played the supporting role of Kevyn Shecket, [[Kirstie Alley]]'s personal makeup artist, on the [[Showtime (TV network)|Showtime]] series ''[[Fat Actress]]'' in 2005.{{cite web| url= http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/rachael-harris/bio/193818/| title= Rachael Harris: Celebrity: Biography| website= [[TV Guide|TVGuide.com]] | accessdate= February 16, 2016}} She also appears in ''[[Suits (U.S. TV series)|Suits]]'' as Sheila Sazs, Louis Litt's on-and-off again love interest. She played Cooper in the ABC sitcom ''[[Notes from the Underbelly]]''. Harris hosted ''Smoking Gun TV'' in 2004, and has made multiple appearances on such [[VH1]] documentaries as ''[[I Love the '80s (U.S. TV series)|I Love the '80s]]'', ''[[I Love the '90s (U.S. TV series)|I Love the '90s]]'', and ''[[Best Week Ever]]''. On ABC's ''[[Cougar Town]]'', she played Shanna, a woman that the network describes as being the "nemesis" of Jules.{{cite news | first= Mickey |last= O'Connor | title=Rachael Harris Signs On to Cougar Town| url=http://www.tvguide.com/News/Rachael-Harris-Cougar-1010803.aspx| work=TVGuide.com}} Also on ABC, she made a guest appearance in the ''[[Modern Family]]'' episode "[[Caught in the Act (Modern Family)|Caught in the Act]]" as a Amelia, a restaurateur and mother to a playmate of Lily Pritchett. In March 2014, Harris began a new role in the very short-lived series ''[[Surviving Jack]]'' with [[Chris Meloni]].{{cite news|last=Rodman|first=Sarah|title=In ‘Surviving Jack,’ Meloni slips comfortably into comedy| url=https://www.bostonglobe.com/arts/television/2014/03/25/surviving-jack-meloni-slips-comfortably-into-comedy/vn7KzAAJ9UFKXmaD14F4UK/story.html|accessdate=2014-03-28|newspaper=[[Boston Globe]]|date=2014-03-26}} In March 2015, Harris was cast as Linda, Lucifer's therapist in the FOX television series ''[[Lucifer (TV series)|Lucifer]]''.{{cite web|url=http://dctvuniverse.com/2015/03/d-b-woodside-and-rachael-harris-board-lucifer/|title=D.B. Woodside And Rachael Harris Board ‘Lucifer’| website= DCtvuniverse.com |last= Yohannes| first= Alamin |date=March 14, 2015}} ===Feature films=== Her film credits include roles in ''[[Best in Show (film)|Best in Show]]'', ''[[A Mighty Wind]]'', ''[[For Your Consideration (film)|For Your Consideration]]'', ''[[Kicking & Screaming (2005 film)|Kicking & Screaming]]'', and ''[[Daddy Day Care]]''. In the 2009 comedy ''[[The Hangover (film)|The Hangover]]'' she plays Melissa, girlfriend to [[Ed Helms]]'s character Stu. She previously co-starred with Helms on ''The Daily Show''.{{cite web |url=http://www.lonokedemocrat.com/articles/2009/06/25/entertainment/ent01.txt |title=lonokenews.net – Archives |publisher=Lonokedemocrat.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20120630190227/http://www.lonokedemocrat.com/articles/2009/06/25/entertainment/ent01.txt |archivedate=2012-06-30 |df= }} She plays the mother of the main character in the film ''[[Diary of a Wimpy Kid]]'' (2010) and its two sequels. ===Advertisements=== Harris' [[TV commercial]] work includes ads for [[Hormel|Dinty Moore]], [[Avis Rent a Car System|Avis]], [[Expedia]], [[Quaker Oats]], [[T-Mobile]], [[GEICO]], and a [[Super Bowl]] commercial for the [[2010 United States Census|2010 Census]].{{cite web| url=http://www.spike.com/video/census-2010-ed/3334763 |title=Census 2010 – Ed Begley Jr. |website= Spike.com |date=2010-02-07 |accessdate=2011-03-12}} She is the voice of turtle Karolyn [[Slowskys|Slowsky]] in the [[Comcast]] Slowskys television commercials. ==Personal life== Harris was born in [[Worthington, Ohio|Worthington]], [[Ohio]]. She graduated from [[Thomas Worthington High School|Worthington High School]] in 1986 and [[Otterbein College]] in 1989, earning a [[Bachelor of Fine Arts]] in theatre.{{cite web|url=http://www.tvguide.com/celebrities/rachael-harris/bio/193818 |title=Rachael Harris Biography |publisher=Tvguide.com |date= |accessdate=2011-03-12}} Harris and violinist [[Christian Hebel]] [[eloped]] in early 2015 and wed in New York City. On July 19, 2016, Harris gave birth to her first child, son Henry, with Hebel. On February 8th, 2018, on Live with Kelly and Ryan (from the Bahamas), Harris announced that she and Hebel are expecting their second child.[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-3732197/Lucifer-star-Rachael-Harris-48-welcomes-son-Henry-violinist-husband-Christian-Hebel.html Lucifer star Rachael Harris, 48, welcomes son Henry with violinist husband Christian Hebel] ==Filmography== {| class="wikitable" |+ Film |- !
